alert.note: Alert for Champaign; De Witt; Douglas; Macon; Moultrie; Piatt; Vermilion (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:10PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FUNNEL CLOUDS SIGHTED NEAR FARMER CITY AND BEMENT... Around 7 pm, the public reported funnel clouds near Farmer City in De Witt County, and Bement in Piatt County. These were along a bands of showers dropping southward. Atmospheric conditions exist that favor the possible formation of weak circulations, in an area roughly from Decatur east to Danville. Some of these circulations are occurring underneath developing showers and thunderstorms, where a funnel cloud may develop. Once the rain begins, the funnel cloud usually dissipates. The threat is expected to diminish around sunset. Low hanging clouds can also appear to dip up and down at times, but they will not show signs of any rapid rotation. An actual funnel cloud will exhibit spinning in a counter-clockwise direction. In rare instances these funnels may briefly touch down. Stay alert and be prepared to move to a safe shelter if a funnel cloud approaches the ground.

area.areaDesc: Champaign; De Witt; Douglas; Macon; Moultrie; Piatt; Vermilion
